function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Relatively high self-reported compliance with coronavirus mitigation measures","Impact":"Potential false sense of security leading to reduced vigilance","Mitigation":"Public awareness campaigns to remind people of ongoing risks and the need for continued compliance","Technologies":"None specified","People":"General public in the Netherlands","Owner":"Public health authorities or government agencies"},{"Description":"Inability to analyze changes in behavior due to single moment measurement","Impact":"Limited understanding of long-term trends and potential fluctuations in compliance levels","Mitigation":"Conducting repeated measurements over time to track changes in behavior and compliance levels","Technologies":"Data collection and analysis tools for longitudinal studies","People":"Research organizations and public health agencies","Owner":"Research organizations and public health agencies"},{"Description":"Mixed results on the relationship between moral support for measures and compliant behavior","Impact":"Difficulty in predicting and influencing compliance based on moral support alone","Mitigation":"Targeted messaging and communication to emphasize the importance of compliance based on personal fear and moral beliefs","Technologies":"Social media platforms, public information campaigns","People":"General public in the Netherlands","Owner":"Public health authorities or government agencies"},{"Description":"Prediction that greater costs of compliance would predict less compliance","Impact":"Potential for reduced compliance if perceived costs outweigh perceived benefits","Mitigation":"Providing incentives for compliance, such as subsidies for protective equipment or financial support for those impacted by compliance measures","Technologies":"Digital tracking tools for verifying compliance, financial support systems","People":"General public in the Netherlands","Owner":"Public health authorities or government agencies"}]}
